steps.text: Clean new external composite surface with approved cleaner to remove mold release materials.
Sand old or new gelcoat to remove imperfections using a DA sander and grade 80+ abrasive discs.
Apply dry guide coat and re-sand for an even texture.
Mix Marine Blister Repair Filler and apply, then feather the repair and sand.
Apply Marine Premium Filler in tight coats and sand with grade 120+ abrasive discs.
Finish by sanding the repair area with grade 220+ abrasive discs.
Ensure surface is dry and mask it with 3M tapes and Purple Premium Plus Masking Film.
Mix gelcoat in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 disposable spray cup, adjust settings on Performance Spray Gun, and apply gelcoat.
For gelcoat finishing process, choose between a 6-step or 5-step process.

If 6-step process: clean new surface with approved cleaner, sand refinement with Hookit 775L Cubitron II abrasives and Soft Interface Pad, sand scratch refinement with P1200 grade Hookit Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs, compound the surface with Perfect-It Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound and Low Linting Wool Compounding Pad using a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm, and apply Perfect-It Boat Wax.

If 5-step process: clean new surface with approved cleaner, sand with Hookit 775L Cubitron II abrasives and Soft Interface Pad or start with P800 grade Hookit Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs, and sand scratch refinement with P1200 grade Hookit Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Sand the surface using a DA sander and 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 80+ grade abrasive discs.
Apply 3M Marine Premium Filler and follow the instructions for setting, sanding, and cleaning.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix primer in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a Performance Spray Gun held 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Sand the primer using dry guide coat and 320+ grade abrasive discs, then repeat with 400+ grade.
Mix marine paint in a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a Performance Spray Gun.
Choose between dry or wet sanding for finishing, using the specified discs and methods.
Refine scratches using the specified foam abrasive discs.
Evaluate product suitability and follow regulations.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Sand the bottom surface using a dual-action sander and 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 220+ grade abrasive.
Apply 3M Marine Premium Filler, sand after curing, and finish with 220+ grade.
Dry the surface and apply masking tapes and film as described.
Mix bottom paint using a 3M PPS Series 2.0 cup and apply with a 3M Performance Spray Gun.
Apply 3M Perfect-It Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area and wipe clean before it dries.
Consult a safety professional.
Visit www.3M.com for contact information.

constraints.text: Evaluate product suitability, follow regulations, and use appropriate safety equipment.
